relatedModules.summary: This module provides APIs for connecting and interacting with GraphQL endpoints.
This module provides a way to load data from a data source with batching and caching capabilities.
This module provides a way to create a subgraphs for a federated GraphQL service

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the enum value

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of the enum value

fields.name: isDeprecated
fields.description: Whether the enum value is deprecated

fields.name: deprecationReason
fields.description: The reason for deprecation of the enum value

records.name: __EnumValue
records.description: Represents a GraphQL enum value.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the field

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of the field

fields.name: args
fields.description: The arguments of the field

fields.name: isDeprecated
fields.description: Whether the field is deprecated

fields.name: deprecationReason
fields.description: The reason for deprecation of the field

records.name: __Field
records.description: Represents a GraphQL field.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the input value

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of the input value

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: The default value of the input value, if there is one

records.name: __InputValue
records.description: Represents a GraphQL input value.

fields.name: kind
fields.description: The `__TypeKind` of the type

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the type. This can be nil if the type is `NON_NULL` or `LIST`

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of the type

fields.name: fields
fields.description:
The fields of the type. This only applies if the `kind` is `OBJECT` or `INTERFACE`. Otherwise,
this will be nil.

fields.name: interfaces
fields.description:
The interfaces of the type. This only applies if the `kind` is `OBJECT` or `INTERFACE`. Otherwise,
this will be nil.

fields.name: possibleTypes
fields.description:
The possible types of the type. This only applies if the `kind` is `UNION` or `INTERFACE`.
Otherwise, this will be nil.

fields.name: enumValues
fields.description: The enum values of the type. This only applies if the `kind` is `ENUM`. Otherwise, this will be nil.

fields.name: inputFields
fields.description:
The input fields of the type. This only applies if the `kind` is `INPUT_OBJECT`. Otherwise,
this will be nil.

fields.name: ofType
fields.description: The type of the type. This only applies if the `kind` is `NON_NULL` or `LIST`. Otherwise, this will be nil.

records.name: __Type
records.description: Represents a GraphQL schema type.

inclusionType.name: BearerTokenConfig
inclusionType.description: Represents token for Bearer token authentication.

memberTypes.name: token
memberTypes.description: Bearer token for authentication

records.name: BearerTokenConfig
records.description: Represents token for Bearer token authentication.

inclusionType.name: CacheConfig
inclusionType.description: Provides a set of configurations for controlling the caching behaviour of the endpoint.

memberTypes.name: enabled
memberTypes.description: Specifies whether HTTP caching is enabled. Caching is enabled by default.

memberTypes.name: isShared
memberTypes.description: Specifies whether the HTTP caching layer should behave as a public cache or a private cache

memberTypes.name: capacity
memberTypes.description: The capacity of the cache

memberTypes.name: evictionFactor
memberTypes.description:
The fraction of entries to be removed when the cache is full. The value should be
between 0 (exclusive) and 1 (inclusive).

memberTypes.name: policy
memberTypes.description:
Gives the user some control over the caching behaviour. By default, this is set to
`CACHE_CONTROL_AND_VALIDATORS`. The default behaviour is to allow caching only when the `cache-control`
header and either the `etag` or `last-modified` header are present.

records.name: CacheConfig
records.description: Provides a set of configurations for controlling the caching behaviour of the endpoint.

inclusionType.name: CircuitBreakerConfig
inclusionType.description: Provides a set of configurations for controlling the behaviour of the Circuit Breaker.

records.name: CircuitBreakerConfig
records.description: Provides a set of configurations for controlling the behaviour of the Circuit Breaker.

fields.name: http1Settings
fields.description: Configurations related to HTTP/1.1 protocol

fields.name: timeout
fields.description: The maximum time to wait (in seconds) for a response before closing the connection

fields.name: forwarded
fields.description: The choice of setting `forwarded`/`x-forwarded` header

fields.name: followRedirects
fields.description: Configurations associated with Redirection

fields.name: poolConfig

fields.name: cache

fields.name: compression
fields.description: Specifies the way of handling compression (`accept-encoding`) header

fields.name: auth
fields.description: Configurations related to client authentication

fields.name: circuitBreaker
fields.description: Configurations associated with the behaviour of the Circuit Breaker

fields.name: responseLimits

fields.name: secureSocket
fields.description: SSL/TLS-related options

fields.name: proxy
fields.description: Proxy server related options

fields.name: validation
fields.description: Enables the inbound payload validation functionality which provided by the constraint package. Enabled by default

records.name: ClientConfiguration
records.description:
Provides a set of configurations for controlling the behaviour of the GraphQL client when communicating with
the GraphQL server that operates over HTTP.

inclusionType.name: ClientHttp1Settings
inclusionType.description: Provides settings related to HTTP/1.x protocol.

memberTypes.name: keepAlive
memberTypes.description: Specifies whether to reuse a connection for multiple requests

memberTypes.name: chunking
memberTypes.description: The chunking behaviour of the request

memberTypes.name: proxy
memberTypes.description: Proxy server related options

records.name: ClientHttp1Settings
records.description: Provides settings related to HTTP/1.x protocol.

inclusionType.name: ClientSecureSocket
inclusionType.description: Provides configurations for facilitating secure communication with a remote HTTP endpoint.

memberTypes.name: enable
memberTypes.description: Enable SSL validation

memberTypes.name: cert
memberTypes.description: Configurations associated with `crypto:TrustStore` or single certificate file that the client trusts

memberTypes.name: key
memberTypes.description: Configurations associated with `crypto:KeyStore` or combination of certificate and private key of the client

memberTypes.name: protocol
memberTypes.description: SSL/TLS protocol related options

elementType.description: Provides configurations for facilitating secure communication with a remote HTTP endpoint.

memberTypes.name: certValidation
memberTypes.description: Certificate validation against OCSP_CRL, OCSP_STAPLING related options

elementType.description: Provides configurations for facilitating secure communication with a remote HTTP endpoint.

memberTypes.name: ciphers
memberTypes.description:
List of ciphers to be used
eg: TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256, TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA

memberTypes.name: verifyHostName
memberTypes.description: Enable/disable host name verification

memberTypes.name: shareSession
memberTypes.description: Enable/disable new SSL session creation

memberTypes.name: handshakeTimeout
memberTypes.description: SSL handshake time out

memberTypes.name: sessionTimeout
memberTypes.description: SSL session time out

memberTypes.name: serverName
memberTypes.description: Server name indication(SNI) to be used. If this is not present, hostname from the target URL will be used

records.name: ClientSecureSocket
records.description: Provides configurations for facilitating secure communication with a remote GraphQL endpoint.

inclusionType.name: CookieConfig
inclusionType.description: Client configuration for cookies.

memberTypes.name: enabled
memberTypes.description: User agents provide users with a mechanism for disabling or enabling cookies

memberTypes.name: maxCookiesPerDomain
memberTypes.description: Maximum number of cookies per domain, which is 50

memberTypes.name: maxTotalCookieCount
memberTypes.description: Maximum number of total cookies allowed to be stored in cookie store, which is 3000

memberTypes.name: blockThirdPartyCookies
memberTypes.description: User can block cookies from third party responses and refuse to send cookies for third party requests, if needed

memberTypes.name: persistentCookieHandler
memberTypes.description:
To manage persistent cookies, users are provided with a mechanism for specifying a persistent cookie store with their own mechanism
which references the persistent cookie handler or specifying the CSV persistent cookie handler. If not specified any, only the session cookies are used

records.name: CookieConfig
records.description: Client configuration for cookies.

inclusionType.name: CorsConfig
inclusionType.description: Configurations for CORS support.

memberTypes.name: allowHeaders
memberTypes.description: The array of allowed headers by the service

memberTypes.name: allowMethods
memberTypes.description: The array of allowed methods by the service

memberTypes.name: allowOrigins
memberTypes.description: The array of origins with which the response is shared by the service

memberTypes.name: exposeHeaders
memberTypes.description: The allowlisted headers, which clients are allowed to access

memberTypes.name: allowCredentials
memberTypes.description: Specifies whether credentials are required to access the service

memberTypes.name: maxAge
memberTypes.description: The maximum duration to cache the preflight from client side

records.name: CorsConfig
records.description: Represent CORS configurations for internal HTTP service

inclusionType.name: ErrorDetail
inclusionType.description: Represents the details of an error occurred during parsing, validating, or executing a GraphQL document.

memberTypes.name: message

memberTypes.name: locations
memberTypes.description: The locations in the GraphQL document related to the error

memberTypes.name: path
memberTypes.description: The path of the field in the GraphQL document related to the error

memberTypes.name: extensions
memberTypes.description: Additional information to error

records.name: ErrorDetail
records.description: Represents an error in GraphQL.

records.name: FileUserStoreConfig

fields.description: File user store configurations for Basic Auth authentication

fields.name: scopes
fields.description: Scopes allowed for authorization

records.name: FileUserStoreConfigWithScopes
records.description: Represents the auth annotation for file user store configurations with scopes.

inclusionType.name: FollowRedirects
inclusionType.description:
Provides configurations for controlling the endpoint's behaviour in response to HTTP redirect related responses.
The response status codes of 301, 302, and 303 are redirected using a GET request while 300, 305, 307, and 308
status codes use the original request HTTP method during redirection.

memberTypes.name: enabled
memberTypes.description: Enable/disable redirection

memberTypes.name: maxCount
memberTypes.description: Maximum number of redirects to follow

memberTypes.name: allowAuthHeaders
memberTypes.description:
By default Authorization and Proxy-Authorization headers are removed from the redirect requests.
Set it to true if Auth headers are needed to be sent during the redirection

records.name: FollowRedirects
records.description: Provides configurations for controlling the endpoint's behaviour in response to HTTP redirect related responses.

fields.description: Meta information on protocol extensions from the GraphQL server

fields.name: data
fields.description: The requested data from the GraphQL server

records.description: Represents the target type binding record with data and extensions of a GraphQL response for `executeWithType` method.

Represents the target type binding record with data and extensions of a GraphQL response for `executeWithType` method.

fields.name: errors

fields.name: printUrl

records.description: Represent GraphiQL client configurations

fields.name: global
fields.description: Scope of the interceptor. If `true`, the interceptor will be applied to all the resolvers.

records.description: Provides a set of configurations for the GraphQL interceptors.

fields.name: auth

fields.name: contextInit

fields.name: graphiql

fields.name: schemaString
fields.description:
The generated schema. This is auto-generated at the compile-time. Providing a value for this field will end up in
a compilation error.

fields.name: interceptors

fields.name: introspection

fields.name: validation
fields.description: Whether to enable or disable the constraint validation

fields.name: cacheConfig
fields.description: The cache configurations for the operations

fields.name: fieldCacheConfig
fields.description: The field cache config derived from the resource annotations. This is auto-generated at the compile time

fields.name: queryComplexityConfig
fields.description: The query complexity configuration for the service.

records.name: GraphqlServiceConfig
records.description: Provides a set of configurations for the GraphQL service.

memberTypes.name: customClaims

memberTypes.description: Clock skew (in seconds) that can be used to avoid token validation failures due to clock synchronization problems

inclusionType.name: LdapUserStoreConfig
inclusionType.description: Represents the LDAP user store configurations.

memberTypes.name: domainName
memberTypes.description: Unique name to identify the user store

memberTypes.name: connectionUrl
memberTypes.description: Connection URL of the LDAP server

memberTypes.name: connectionName
memberTypes.description: The username used to connect to the LDAP server

memberTypes.name: connectionPassword
memberTypes.description: The password used to connect to the LDAP server

memberTypes.name: userSearchBase
memberTypes.description: DN of the context or object under which the user entries are stored in the LDAP server

memberTypes.name: userEntryObjectClass
memberTypes.description: Object class used to construct user entries

memberTypes.name: userNameAttribute
memberTypes.description: The attribute used for uniquely identifying a user entry

memberTypes.name: userNameSearchFilter
memberTypes.description: Filtering criteria used to search for a particular user entry

memberTypes.name: userNameListFilter
memberTypes.description: Filtering criteria for searching user entries in the LDAP server

memberTypes.name: groupSearchBase
memberTypes.description: DN of the context or object under which the group entries are stored in the LDAP server

memberTypes.name: groupEntryObjectClass
memberTypes.description: Object class used to construct group entries

memberTypes.name: groupNameAttribute
memberTypes.description: The attribute used for uniquely identifying a group entry

memberTypes.name: groupNameSearchFilter
memberTypes.description: Filtering criteria used to search for a particular group entry

memberTypes.name: groupNameListFilter
memberTypes.description: Filtering criteria for searching group entries in the LDAP server

memberTypes.name: membershipAttribute
memberTypes.description: Define the attribute, which contains the distinguished names (DN) of user objects that are there in a group

memberTypes.name: userRolesCacheEnabled
memberTypes.description: To indicate whether to cache the role list of a user

memberTypes.name: connectionPoolingEnabled
memberTypes.description: Define whether LDAP connection pooling is enabled

memberTypes.name: connectionTimeout
memberTypes.description: Connection timeout (in seconds) when making the initial LDAP connection

memberTypes.name: readTimeout
memberTypes.description: Reading timeout (in seconds) for LDAP operations

memberTypes.name: secureSocket
memberTypes.description: The SSL configurations for the LDAP client socket. This needs to be configured in order to communicate through LDAPs

records.name: LdapUserStoreConfig
records.description: Represents LDAP user store configurations for Basic Auth authentication.

fields.description: LDAP user store configurations for Basic Auth authentication

fields.name: scopes

records.description: Represents the auth annotation for LDAP user store configurations with scopes.

inclusionType.name: ListenerConfiguration
inclusionType.description: Provides a set of configurations for HTTP service endpoints.

memberTypes.name: host
memberTypes.description: The host name/IP of the endpoint

memberTypes.name: http1Settings
memberTypes.description: Configurations related to HTTP/1.x protocol

memberTypes.name: secureSocket
memberTypes.description:
The SSL configurations for the service endpoint. This needs to be configured in order to
communicate through HTTPS.

memberTypes.name: httpVersion
memberTypes.description: Highest HTTP version supported by the endpoint

memberTypes.name: timeout
memberTypes.description:
Period of time in seconds that a connection waits for a read/write operation. Use value 0 to
disable timeout

memberTypes.name: server
memberTypes.description: The server name which should appear as a response header

memberTypes.name: requestLimits
memberTypes.description: Configurations associated with inbound request size limits

memberTypes.name: gracefulStopTimeout
memberTypes.description: Grace period of time in seconds for listener gracefulStop

memberTypes.name: socketConfig
memberTypes.description: Provides settings related to server socket configuration

memberTypes.name: http2InitialWindowSize
memberTypes.description: Configuration to change the initial window size in HTTP/2

memberTypes.name: minIdleTimeInStaleState
memberTypes.description:
Minimum time in seconds for a connection to be kept open which has received a GOAWAY.
This only applies for HTTP/2. Default value is 5 minutes. If the value is set to -1,
the connection will be closed after all in-flight streams are completed

memberTypes.name: timeBetweenStaleEviction
memberTypes.description:
Time between the connection stale eviction runs in seconds. This only applies for HTTP/2.
Default value is 30 seconds

records.name: ListenerConfiguration
records.description: Provides a set of configurations for configure the underlying HTTP listener of the GraphQL listener.

inclusionType.name: ListenerHttp1Settings
inclusionType.description: Provides settings related to HTTP/1.x protocol.

memberTypes.name: keepAlive
memberTypes.description:
Can be set to either `KEEPALIVE_AUTO`, which respects the `connection` header, or `KEEPALIVE_ALWAYS`,
which always keeps the connection alive, or `KEEPALIVE_NEVER`, which always closes the connection

memberTypes.name: maxPipelinedRequests
memberTypes.description:
Defines the maximum number of requests that can be processed at a given time on a single
connection. By default 10 requests can be pipelined on a single connection and user can
change this limit appropriately.

records.name: ListenerHttp1Settings
records.description:
Provides settings related to HTTP/1.x protocol, when using HTTP 1.x as the underlying protocol for the GraphQL
service.

inclusionType.name: ListenerSecureSocket
inclusionType.description: Configures the SSL/TLS options to be used for HTTP service.

memberTypes.name: key
memberTypes.description: Configurations associated with `crypto:KeyStore` or combination of certificate and (PKCS8) private key of the server

memberTypes.name: mutualSsl
memberTypes.description: Configures associated with mutual SSL operations

elementType.description: Configures the SSL/TLS options to be used for HTTP service.

memberTypes.name: protocol
memberTypes.description: SSL/TLS protocol related options

elementType.description: Configures the SSL/TLS options to be used for HTTP service.

memberTypes.name: certValidation
memberTypes.description: Certificate validation against OCSP_CRL, OCSP_STAPLING related options

elementType.description: Configures the SSL/TLS options to be used for HTTP service.

memberTypes.name: ciphers
memberTypes.description:
List of ciphers to be used
eg: TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256, TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA

memberTypes.name: shareSession
memberTypes.description: Enable/Disable new SSL session creation

memberTypes.name: handshakeTimeout
memberTypes.description: SSL handshake time out

memberTypes.name: sessionTimeout
memberTypes.description: SSL session time out

records.name: ListenerSecureSocket
records.description: Configures the SSL/TLS options to be used for the underlying HTTP service used in GraphQL service.

inclusionType.name: PoolConfiguration
inclusionType.description: Configurations for managing HTTP client connection pool.

memberTypes.name: maxActiveConnections
memberTypes.description: Max active connections per route(host:port). Default value is -1 which indicates unlimited.

memberTypes.name: maxIdleConnections
memberTypes.description: Maximum number of idle connections allowed per pool.

memberTypes.name: waitTime
memberTypes.description: Maximum amount of time (in seconds), the client should wait for an idle connection before it sends an error when the pool is exhausted

memberTypes.name: maxActiveStreamsPerConnection
memberTypes.description: Maximum active streams per connection. This only applies to HTTP/2. Default value is 100

memberTypes.name: minEvictableIdleTime
memberTypes.description: Minimum evictable time for an idle connection in seconds. Default value is 5 minutes

memberTypes.name: timeBetweenEvictionRuns
memberTypes.description: Time between eviction runs in seconds. Default value is 30 seconds

memberTypes.name: minIdleTimeInStaleState
memberTypes.description:
Minimum time in seconds for a connection to be kept open which has received a GOAWAY.
This only applies for HTTP/2. Default value is 5 minutes. If the value is set to -1,
the connection will be closed after all in-flight streams are completed

memberTypes.name: timeBetweenStaleEviction
memberTypes.description:
Time between the connection stale eviction runs in seconds. This only applies for HTTP/2.
Default value is 30 seconds

records.name: PoolConfiguration
records.description: Configurations for managing GraphQL client connection pool.

inclusionType.name: ProxyConfig
inclusionType.description: Proxy server configurations to be used with the HTTP client endpoint.

memberTypes.name: host
memberTypes.description: Host name of the proxy server

memberTypes.name: port
memberTypes.description: Proxy server port

memberTypes.name: userName
memberTypes.description: Proxy server username

memberTypes.name: password
memberTypes.description: proxy server password

records.name: ProxyConfig
records.description: Proxy server configurations to be used with the GraphQL client endpoint.

fields.name: maxComplexity
fields.description: Maximum allowed query depth

fields.name: defaultFieldComplexity
fields.description: Default complexity for a field

fields.name: warnOnly
fields.description: Whether to only log a warning or return an error when the complexity exceeds the limit

records.name: QueryComplexityConfig
records.description: Defines the query complexity configuration for the GraphQL service.

inclusionType.name: RequestLimitConfigs
inclusionType.description: Provides inbound request URI, total header and entity body size threshold configurations.

memberTypes.name: maxUriLength
memberTypes.description:
Maximum allowed length for a URI. Exceeding this limit will result in a `414 - URI Too Long`
response. For HTTP/2, this limit will not be applicable as it already has a `:path`
pseudo-header which will be validated by `maxHeaderSize`

memberTypes.name: maxHeaderSize
memberTypes.description:
Maximum allowed size for headers. Exceeding this limit will result in a
`431 - Request Header Fields Too Large` response

memberTypes.name: maxEntityBodySize
memberTypes.description:
Maximum allowed size for the entity body. By default it is set to -1 which means there
is no restriction `maxEntityBodySize`, On the Exceeding this limit will result in a
`413 - Payload Too Large` response

records.name: RequestLimitConfigs
records.description: Provides inbound request URI, total header and entity body size threshold configurations.

inclusionType.name: ResponseLimitConfigs
inclusionType.description: Provides inbound response status line, total header and entity body size threshold configurations.

memberTypes.name: maxStatusLineLength
memberTypes.description:
Maximum allowed length for response status line(`HTTP/1.1 200 OK`). Exceeding this limit will
result in a `ClientError`

memberTypes.name: maxHeaderSize
memberTypes.description: Maximum allowed size for headers. Exceeding this limit will result in a `ClientError`

memberTypes.name: maxEntityBodySize
memberTypes.description:
Maximum allowed size for the entity body. By default it is set to -1 which means there is no
restriction `maxEntityBodySize`, On the Exceeding this limit will result in a `ClientError`

records.name: ResponseLimitConfigs
records.description: Provides inbound response status line, total header and entity body size threshold configurations.

inclusionType.name: RetryConfig
inclusionType.description: Provides configurations for controlling the retrying behavior in failure scenarios.

memberTypes.name: count
memberTypes.description: Number of retry attempts before giving up

memberTypes.name: interval
memberTypes.description: Retry interval in seconds

memberTypes.name: backOffFactor
memberTypes.description: Multiplier, which increases the retry interval exponentially.

memberTypes.name: maxWaitInterval
memberTypes.description: Maximum time of the retry interval in seconds

memberTypes.name: statusCodes
memberTypes.description: HTTP response status codes which are considered as failures

records.name: RetryConfig
records.description: Provides configurations for controlling the retrying behavior in failure scenarios.

fields.name: enabled
fields.description: State of the caching

fields.name: maxAge
fields.description: TTL of the cache in seconds

fields.name: maxSize
fields.description: Maximum number of cache entries

records.name: ServerCacheConfig
records.description: Represent the cache configurations of GraphQL server.

fields.name: fileName
fields.description: Name of the file

fields.name: mimeType
fields.description: File mime type according to the content

fields.name: encoding
fields.description: File stream encoding

fields.name: byteStream
fields.description: File content as a stream of `byte[]`

records.name: Upload
records.description: The input parameter type used for file uploads in GraphQL mutations.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: Value to be set

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets a given value for a given key in the GraphQL context.

returnParameters.description: The value if the key is present in the context, a `graphql:Error` otherwise

methods.name: get
methods.description:
Retrieves a value using the given key from the GraphQL context.
```ballerina
string userId = check context.get("userId").ensureType();  
```

returnParameters.description: The value if the key is present in the context, a `graphql:Error` otherwise

methods.name: remove
methods.description:
Removes a value using the given key from the GraphQL context.
```ballerina
string userId = check context.remove("userId").ensureType();  
```

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key for the DataLoader to be registered

parameters.name: dataloader
parameters.description: The DataLoader instance to be registered

methods.name: registerDataLoader

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key corresponding to the required DataLoader instance

returnParameters.description: The DataLoader instance if the key is present in the context otherwise panics

methods.name: getDataLoader
methods.description:
Retrieves a DataLoader instance using the given key from the GraphQL context.
```ballerina
dataloader:DataLoader userDataLoader = check context.getDataLoader("user");
```

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path corresponding to the cache entries to be removed (Ex: "person.address.city")

returnParameters.description: The error if the cache invalidateion fails or nil otherwise

methods.name: invalidate
methods.description: Remove cache entries related to the given path.

returnParameters.description: The error if the cache invalidateion fails or nil otherwise

methods.name: invalidateAll
methods.description: Remove all cache entries.

parameters.description: Value to be set

classes.name: Context

returnParameters.description: The name of the field

methods.name: getName
methods.description: Returns the name of the field.

returnParameters.description: The alias of the field. If an alias is not present, the field name will be returned

methods.name: getAlias
methods.description: Returns the effective alias of the field.

returnParameters.description: The path of the field

methods.name: getPath
methods.description:
Returns the current path of the field. If the field returns an array, the path will include the index of the
element.

returnParameters.description: The subfield objects of this field

methods.name: getSubfields
methods.description: Returns the subfields of this field as a `Field` object array.

returnParameters.description: The names of the subfields of this field

methods.name: getSubfieldNames
methods.description: Returns the names of the subfields of this field as a string array.

returnParameters.description: The type of the field

methods.name: getType
methods.description: Returns the type of the field.

returnParameters.description: The location of the field

methods.name: getLocation
methods.description: Returns the location of the field in the GraphQL document.

classes.name: Field
classes.description: Represents the information about a particular field of a GraphQL document.

parameters.name: document
parameters.description:
The GraphQL document. It can include queries & mutations.
For example `query OperationName($code:ID!) {country(code:$code) {name}}`.

parameters.name: variables
parameters.description: The GraphQL variables. For example `{"code": "<variable_value>"}`.

parameters.name: operationName
parameters.description:
The GraphQL operation name. If a request has two or more operations, then each operation must have a name.
A request can only execute one operation, so you must also include the operation name to execute.

parameters.name: headers
parameters.description: The GraphQL API headers to execute each query

parameters.name: targetType
parameters.description:
The payload, which is expected to be returned after data binding. For example
`type CountryByCodeResponse record {| map<json?> extensions?; record {| record{|string name;|}? country; |} data;`

returnParameters.description:
The GraphQL response or a `graphql:ClientError` if failed to execute the query
# Deprecated
This method is now deprecated. Use the `client->execute()` API instead

remoteMethods.name: executeWithType
remoteMethods.description:
Executes a GraphQL document and data binds the GraphQL response to a record with data and extensions
which is a subtype of GenericResponse.
descriptionSections:
# Deprecated
This method is now deprecated. Use the `client->execute()` API instead

parameters.name: document
parameters.description:
The GraphQL document. It can include queries & mutations.
For example `query countryByCode($code:ID!) {country(code:$code) {name}}`.

parameters.name: variables
parameters.description: The GraphQL variables. For example `{"code": "<variable_value>"}`.

parameters.name: operationName
parameters.description:
The GraphQL operation name. If a request has two or more operations, then each operation must have a name.
A request can only execute one operation, so you must also include the operation name to execute.

parameters.name: headers
parameters.description: The GraphQL API headers to execute each query

parameters.name: targetType
parameters.description:
The payload (`GenericResponseWithErrors`), which is expected to be returned after data binding. For example
`type CountryByCodeResponse record {| map<json?> extensions?; record {| record{|string name;|}? country; |} data; ErrorDetail[] errors?; |};`

returnParameters.description: The GraphQL response or a `graphql:ClientError` if failed to execute the query

remoteMethods.name: execute
remoteMethods.description:
Executes a GraphQL document and data binds the GraphQL response to a record with data, extensions and errors
which is a subtype of GenericResponseWithErrors.

parameters.name: serviceUrl
parameters.description: URL of the target service

parameters.name: clientConfig
parameters.description: The configurations to be used when initializing the `connector`

returnParameters.description: An error at the failure of client initialization

methods.name: init
methods.description: Gets invoked to initialize the `connector`.

The payload, which is expected to be returned after data binding. For example

returnParameters.description:

The GraphQL document. It can include queries & mutations.
For example `query countryByCode($code:ID!) {country(code:$code) {name}}`.

parameters.name: variables

The GraphQL operation name. If a request has two or more operations, then each operation must have a name.

The payload (`GenericResponseWithErrors`), which is expected to be returned after data binding. For example

returnParameters.description: An error at the failure of client initialization

clients.name: Client
clients.description: The Ballerina GraphQL client that can be used to communicate with GraphQL APIs.

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: The `graphql:Service` object to attach to the listener

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The path of the service to be hosted

returnParameters.description:
A `graphql:Error` if an error occurred during the service-attaching process or the schema
generation process or else `()`

lifeCycleMethods.name: attach
lifeCycleMethods.description: Attaches the provided service to the Listener.

parameters.name: listenTo
parameters.description: An `http:Listener` or a port number to listen to the GraphQL service endpoint

parameters.name: configuration
parameters.description: The additional configurations for the GraphQL listener

returnParameters.description: A `graphql:Error` if the listener initialization is failed or else `()`

methods.name: init
methods.description:
Invoked during the initialization of a `graphql:Listener`. Either an `http:Listener` or a port number must be
provided to initialize the listener.

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: The `graphql:Service` object to attach to the listener

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The path of the service to be hosted

returnParameters.description:
A `graphql:Error` if an error occurred during the service-attaching process or the schema
generation process or else `()`

methods.name: attach
methods.description: Attaches the provided service to the Listener.

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: The service to be detached from the listener

returnParameters.description: A `graphql:Error` if an error occurred during the service detaching process or else `()`

methods.name: detach
methods.description: Detaches the provided service from the Listener.

returnParameters.description: A `graphql:Error`, if an error occurred during the service starting process, otherwise nil

methods.name: 'start
methods.description: Starts the attached service.

returnParameters.description: A `graphql:Error`, if an error occurred during the service stopping process, otherwise nil

methods.name: gracefulStop
methods.description: Gracefully stops the graphql listener. Already accepted requests will be served before the connection closure.

returnParameters.description: A `graphql:Error` if an error occurred during the service stopping process or else `()`

methods.name: immediateStop
methods.description: Stops the service listener immediately.

parameters.name: listenTo
parameters.description: An `http:Listener` or a port number to listen to the GraphQL service endpoint

parameters.name: configuration
parameters.description: The additional configurations for the GraphQL listener

returnParameters.description: A `graphql:Error` if the listener initialization is failed or else `()`

initMethod.name: init
initMethod.description:
Invoked during the initialization of a `graphql:Listener`. Either an `http:Listener` or a port number must be
provided to initialize the listener.

returnParameters.description: A `graphql:Error` if an error occurred during the service detaching process or else `()`

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: The context of the GraphQL request.

parameters.name: errorDetail
parameters.description: The error to be added to the response.

functions.name: __addError
functions.description: Adds an error to the GraphQL response. Using this to add an error is not recommended.

parameters.name: encodedSchemaString
parameters.description: Compile time auto generated schema

returnParameters.description: Subgraph schema in SDL format as a string on success, or an error otherwise

functions.name: getSdlString
functions.description: Obtains the schema representation of a federated subgraph, expressed in the SDL format.

constants.name: AUTH_SCHEME_BASIC
constants.description: The prefix used to denote the Basic authentication scheme.

constants.name: AUTH_SCHEME_BEARER
constants.description: The prefix used to denote the Bearer authentication scheme.

constants.name: COMPRESSION_ALWAYS
constants.description: Always set accept-encoding/content-encoding in outbound request/response.

constants.name: COMPRESSION_AUTO
constants.description:
When service behaves as a HTTP gateway inbound request/response accept-encoding option is set as the
outbound request/response accept-encoding/content-encoding option.

constants.name: COMPRESSION_NEVER
constants.description: Never set accept-encoding/content-encoding header in outbound request/response.

annotations.name: ID
annotations.description: Represents the annotation of the ID type.

annotations.name: InterceptorConfig
annotations.description: The annotation to configure a GraphQL interceptor.

annotations.name: ResourceConfig
annotations.description: The annotation to configure a GraphQL resolver.

annotations.name: ServiceConfig
annotations.description: The annotation to configure a GraphQL service.

errors.name: ClientError
errors.description: Represents GraphQL client related generic errors.

errors.name: Error
errors.description: Represents any error related to the Ballerina GraphQL module.

errors.name: InvalidDocumentError
errors.description: Represents GraphQL errors due to request validation.

errors.name: PayloadBindingError
errors.description: Represents client side data binding error.

errors.name: RequestError
errors.description: Represents GraphQL client side or network level errors.

errors.name: ServerError
errors.description: Represents GraphQL API response during GraphQL API server side errors.
descriptionSections:
# Deprecated
This error type will be removed along with the `executeWithType()` API

unionTypes.name: ListenerAuthConfig
unionTypes.description: Defines the authentication configurations for the GraphQL listener.

unionTypes.name: ClientAuthConfig
unionTypes.description: Defines the authentication configurations for the GraphQL client.

unionTypes.name: OAuth2GrantConfig
unionTypes.description: Represents OAuth2 grant configurations for OAuth2 authentication.

unionTypes.name: Scalar
unionTypes.description: Represents the Scalar types supported by the Ballerina GraphQL module.

unionTypes.name: Compression
unionTypes.description: Options to compress using gzip or deflate.

functionTypes.name: ContextInit
functionTypes.description:
Function type for initializing the `graphql:Context` object.
This function will be called with the `http:Request` and the `http:RequestContext` objects from the original request
received to the GraphQL endpoint.

members.name: NON_NULL
members.description: Represents a GraphQL non-null type. If a field is of this type, it is guaranteed to be non-null

members.name: INPUT_OBJECT
members.description: Represents a GraphQL input object type

enums.name: __TypeKind
enums.description: Represents a GraphQL type kind. This is used to represent the kind of a GraphQL type.

modules.summary: This module provides APIs for connecting and interacting with GraphQL endpoints.

the GraphQL server that operates over HTTP.
Provides settings related to HTTP/1.x protocol.
Provides configurations for facilitating secure communication with a remote GraphQL endpoint.
Client configuration for cookies.
Represent CORS configurations for internal HTTP service
Represents credentials for Basic Auth authentication.
Represents an error in GraphQL.
Represents file user store configurations for Basic Auth authentication.
Represents the auth annotation for file user store configurations with scopes.
Provides configurations for controlling the endpoint's behaviour in response to HTTP redirect related responses.

Provides configurations for controlling the retrying behavior in failure scenarios.
